Entities.Name: Positive PAD
Entities.Definition: Indicated by the presence of severe stenosis or occlusion in a lower extremity artery, including and distal to the iliac artery, or prior revascularization such as stenting or balloon angioplasty.
Entities.Sample Data: Patient has severe stenosis in the iliac artery.

Entities.Name: Probable PAD
Entities.Definition: Defined as moderate stenosis in a lower limb artery.
Entities.Sample Data: Patient shows moderate stenosis in the femoral artery.

Entities.Name: Negative PAD
Entities.Definition: The absence of moderate or severe stenosis or occlusion in a lower extremity artery or the presence of only mild stenosis.
Entities.Sample Data: No moderate or severe stenosis observed in the patient.

Entities.Name: Unknown PAD
Entities.Definition: Cases where there is insufficient information to categorize the patient into any of the other categories.
Entities.Sample Data: Insufficient information to determine the presence of PAD.

Dataset.Name: Radiology Notes for PAD Cases
Dataset.Details: Consists of 455 radiology notes, each labeled with one of the four categories: Positive, Probable, Negative, or Unknown PAD.

Annotation Guidelines.Description: Guidelines developed by a cardiovascular specialist for the annotation of radiology notes based on the presence of PAD-related features such as stenosis and revascularization.
Annotation Guidelines.Link: No direct link provided, but related documentation may be found on eMERGE and OHNLP consortium websites.
